text: Howto do reference to ints by name in Python
I want to have a a reference that reads as "whatever variable of name 'x' is pointing to" with ints so that it behaves as:

code:
>>> a = 1
>>> b = 2
>>> c = (a, b)
>>> c
(1, 2)
>>> a = 3
>>> c
(3, 2)

text: I know I could do something similar with lists by doing:

code:
>>> a = [1]
>>> b = [2]
>>> c = (a, b)
>>> c
([1], [2])
>>> a[0] = 3
>>> c
([3], [2])

text: but this can be easily lost if one assigns a or b to something instead of their elements.
Is there a simple way to do this?
